intro: Fagara glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, clustered flowers. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
